Package pitt.search.semanticvectors.orthography

Package for orthographic representation, i.e., making vectors based on the characters that occur in a string.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CharRepresentation
    Class for representing characters in terms of their neighbors, and then building string representations from these characters.
    NumberRepresentation
    Class that generates sequences of evenly distributed vectors to represent numbers between two given end points.
    ProportionVectors
    Gets vectors that represent some proportion between 0 and 1.
    SentenceVectors  
    StringEdit
    Class for getting "string edit" vectors that can be used to measure orthographic distance between strings.

Package pitt.search.semanticvectors.orthography Description

Package for orthographic representation, i.e., making vectors based on the characters that occur in a string.

The basic idea is to make vectors for positions in the string, which have some natural ordering position, and to take bindings of the position vectors (no pun intended) with elemental vectors for the character that occurs in this position, and superposing these pairs along the string to get a representation for the whole string.

Author:
Manuel Wahle, Trevor Cohen, Dominic Widdows.
